result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Karl E. Sutton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
May serve in St Croix County; eligible for good time; Huber granted for work, treatment, elder care
**AMENDED 6/7/18 - Report date changed to 7/22/18
**AMENDED 7/5/18 - Sentenced stayed as to Count 2 only
**AMENDED 4/30/19 - Stay lifted as to Count 2. Defendant eligible for good time. To begin sentence on 6/15/19. Eligible for good time. Huber granted for work, treatment or elder care. Defendant can serve jail time on electronic monitoring device if Minnesota Department of Corrections can monitor. Defendant may serve jail time in neighboring county near Minnesota.

**06-14-2019 - Per Stipulation and Order, the defendant can use a private monitoring company, Midwest Monitoring, to provide electronic monitoring for his jail sentence and they will report any violations to his Agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  Defendant may not withdraw from any ordered program without permission of the agent and/or provider. Defendant is to have no contact with victim.  The Defendant is to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis, unless already provided. Defendant to undergo psychological evaluation and follow up with medication as recommended. Agent to approve of internet access and any significant relationship. Agent to approve of residence.
